50 THE ROMAN PRONUNCJATJON OF LATJN.

Studiously observe the length of the vowel before the ter- minations gnus, gna, gnum.

Remember that the final syllable in m, when not elided, is to be pronounced as lightly and rapidly as possible, the more lightly and indistinctly the better.

Remember that S must not be pronounced as z, except where it represents Î– in Greek words, as Smyrna (Zmyrna), Smaragdus (Zmaragdus), otherwise always pronounce as in sis.

Remember in pronouncing v to direct the lower lip to- ward the upper lip, avoiding the upper teeth.
